entry.label: TI OMAP USBHS core and TLL driver
entry.help: This is the core driver for the OAMP EHCI and OHCI drivers. This MFD driver does the required setup functionalities for OMAP USB Host drivers.

entry.name: MFD_PALMAS
entry.label: TI Palmas series chips
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the Palmas series of PMIC chips from Texas Instruments.

entry.name: TPS6105X
entry.label: TI TPS61050/61052 Boost Converters
entry.help: This option enables a driver for the TP61050/TPS61052 high-power "white LED driver". This boost converter is sometimes used for other things than white LEDs, and also contains a GPIO pin.

entry.name: TPS65010
entry.label: TI TPS6501x Power Management chips
entry.help:
If you say yes here you get support for the TPS6501x series of Power Management chips. These include voltage regulators, lithium ion/polymer battery charging, and other features that are often used in portable devices like cell phones and cameras.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called tps65010.

entry.name: TPS6507X
entry.label: TI TPS6507x Power Management / Touch Screen chips
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the TPS6507x series of Power Management / Touch Screen chips. These include voltage regulators, lithium ion/polymer battery charging, touch screen and other features that are often used in portable devices. This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called tps6507x.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65086
entry.label: TI TPS65086 Power Management Integrated Chips (PMICs)
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the TPS65086 series of Power Management chips. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65090
entry.label: TI TPS65090 Power Management chips
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the TPS65090 series of Power Management chips. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65217
entry.label: TI TPS65217 Power Management / White LED chips
entry.help:
If you say yes here you get support for the TPS65217 series of Power Management / White LED chips. These include voltage regulators, lithium ion/polymer battery charger, wled and other features that are often used in portable devices.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called tps65217.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65218
entry.label: TI TPS65218 Power Management chips
entry.help:
If you say yes here you get support for the TPS65218 series of Power Management chips. These include voltage regulators, gpio and other features that are often used in portable devices. Only regulator component is currently supported.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called tps65218.

entry.name: MFD_TPS6586X
entry.label: TI TPS6586x Power Management chips
entry.help:
If you say yes here you get support for the TPS6586X series of Power Management chips. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called tps6586x.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65910
entry.label: TI TPS65910 Power Management chip
entry.help: if you say yes here you get support for the TPS65910 series of Power Management chips.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65912_I2C
entry.label: TI TPS65912 Power Management chip with I2C
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the TPS65912 series of PM chips with I2C interface.

entry.name: MFD_TPS65912_SPI
entry.label: TI TPS65912 Power Management chip with SPI
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the TPS65912 series of PM chips with SPI interface.

entry.name: MFD_TPS80031
entry.label: TI TPS80031/TPS80032 Power Management chips
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the Texas Instruments TPS80031/ TPS80032 Fully Integrated Power Management with Power Path and Battery Charger. The device provides five configurable step-down converters, 11 general purpose LDOs, USB OTG Module, ADC, RTC, 2 PWM, System Voltage Regulator/Battery Charger with Power Path from USB, 32K clock generator.

entry.name: TWL4030_CORE
entry.label: TI TWL4030/TWL5030/TWL6030/TPS659x0 Support
entry.help:
Say yes here if you have TWL4030 / TWL6030 family chip on your board. This core driver provides register access and IRQ handling facilities, and registers devices for the various functions so that function-specific drivers can bind to them.
These multi-function chips are found on many OMAP2 and OMAP3 boards, providing power management, RTC, GPIO, keypad, a high speed USB OTG transceiver, an audio codec (on most versions) and many other features.

entry.name: TWL4030_POWER
entry.label: TI TWL4030 power resources
entry.help:
Say yes here if you want to use the power resources on the TWL4030 family chips. Most of these resources are regulators, which have a separate driver; some are control signals, such as clock request handshaking.
This driver uses board-specific data to initialize the resources and load scripts controlling which resources are switched off/on or reset when a sleep, wakeup or warm reset event occurs.

entry.name: TWL6040_CORE
entry.label: TI TWL6040 audio codec
entry.help: Say yes here if you want support for Texas Instruments TWL6040 audio codec. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device (audio, vibra).

entry.name: MENELAUS
entry.label: TI TWL92330/Menelaus PM chip
entry.help: If you say yes here you get support for the Texas Instruments TWL92330/Menelaus Power Management chip. This include voltage regulators, Dual slot memory card transceivers, real-time clock and other features that are often used in portable devices like cell phones and PDAs.

entry.name: MFD_WL1273_CORE
entry.label: TI WL1273 FM radio
entry.help: This is the core driver for the TI WL1273 FM radio. This MFD driver connects the radio-wl1273 V4L2 module and the wl1273 audio codec.

entry.name: MFD_LM3533
entry.label: TI/National Semiconductor LM3533 Lighting Power chip
entry.help:
Say yes here to enable support for National Semiconductor / TI LM3533 Lighting Power chips.
This driver provides common support for accessing the device; additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the LED, backlight or ambient-light-sensor functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_TIMBERDALE
entry.label: Timberdale FPGA
entry.help:
This is the core driver for the timberdale FPGA. This device is a multifunction device which exposes numerous platform devices.
The timberdale FPGA can be found on the Intel Atom development board for in-vehicle infontainment, called Russellville.

entry.name: MFD_TC3589X
entry.label: Toshiba TC35892 and variants
entry.help:
Support for the Toshiba TC35892 and variants I/O Expander.
This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_T7L66XB
entry.label: Toshiba T7L66XB
entry.help: Support for Toshiba Mobile IO Controller T7L66XB

entry.name: MFD_TC6387XB
entry.label: Toshiba TC6387XB
entry.help: Support for Toshiba Mobile IO Controller TC6387XB

entry.name: MFD_TC6393XB
entry.label: Toshiba TC6393XB
entry.help: Support for Toshiba Mobile IO Controller TC6393XB

entry.name: MFD_VX855
entry.label: VIA VX855/VX875 integrated south bridge
entry.help: Say yes here to enable support for various functions of the VIA VX855/VX875 south bridge. You will need to enable the vx855_spi and/or vx855_gpio drivers for this to do anything useful.

entry.name: MFD_ARIZONA_I2C
entry.label: Cirrus Logic/Wolfson Microelectronics Arizona platform with I2C
entry.help: Support for the Cirrus Logic/Wolfson Microelectronics Arizona platform audio SoC core functionality controlled via I2C.

entry.name: MFD_ARIZONA_SPI
entry.label: Cirrus Logic/Wolfson Microelectronics Arizona platform with SPI
entry.help: Support for the Cirrus Logic/Wolfson Microelectronics Arizona platform audio SoC core functionality controlled via SPI.

entry.name: MFD_CS47L24
entry.label: Cirrus Logic CS47L24 and WM1831
entry.help: Support for Cirrus Logic CS47L24 and WM1831 low power audio SoC

entry.name: MFD_WM5102
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM5102
entry.help: Support for Wolfson Microelectronics WM5102 low power audio SoC

entry.name: MFD_WM5110
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM5110 and WM8280/WM8281
entry.help: Support for Wolfson Microelectronics WM5110 and WM8280/WM8281 low power audio SoC

entry.name: MFD_WM8997
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8997
entry.help: Support for Wolfson Microelectronics WM8997 low power audio SoC

entry.name: MFD_WM8998
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8998
entry.help: Support for Wolfson Microelectronics WM8998 low power audio SoC

entry.name: MFD_WM8400
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8400
entry.help: Support for the Wolfson Microelecronics WM8400 PMIC and audio CODEC. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_WM831X_I2C
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM831x/2x PMICs with I2C
entry.help: Support for the Wolfson Microelecronics WM831x and WM832x PMICs when controlled using I2C. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_WM831X_SPI
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM831x/2x PMICs with SPI
entry.help: Support for the Wolfson Microelecronics WM831x and WM832x PMICs when controlled using SPI. This driver provides common support for accessing the device, additional drivers must be enabled in order to use the functionality of the device.

entry.name: MFD_WM8350_I2C
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8350 with I2C
entry.help: The WM8350 is an integrated audio and power management subsystem with watchdog and RTC functionality for embedded systems. This option enables core support for the WM8350 with I2C as the control interface. Additional options must be selected to enable support for the functionality of the chip.

entry.name: MFD_WM8994
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8994
entry.help: The WM8994 is a highly integrated hi-fi CODEC designed for smartphone applications. As well as audio functionality it has on board GPIO and regulator functionality which is supported via the relevant subsystems. This driver provides core support for the WM8994, in order to use the actual functionaltiy of the device other drivers must be enabled.

entry.name: MFD_STW481X
entry.label: Support for ST Microelectronics STw481x
entry.help: Select this option to enable the STw481x chip driver used in various ST Microelectronics and ST-Ericsson embedded Nomadik series.

entry.name: MFD_VEXPRESS_SYSREG
entry.label: Versatile Express System Registers
entry.help: System Registers are the platform configuration block on the ARM Ltd. Versatile Express board.

entry.name: REGULATOR
entry.label: Voltage and Current Regulator Support
entry.help:
Generic Voltage and Current Regulator support.
This framework is designed to provide a generic interface to voltage and current regulators within the Linux kernel. It's intended to provide voltage and current control to client or consumer drivers and also provide status information to user space applications through a sysfs interface.
The intention is to allow systems to dynamically control regulator output in order to save power and prolong battery life. This applies to both voltage regulators (where voltage output is controllable) and current sinks (where current output is controllable).
This framework safely compiles out if not selected so that client drivers can still be used in systems with no software controllable regulators.
If unsure, say no.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DEBUG
entry.label: Regulator debug support
entry.help: Say yes here to enable debugging support.

entry.name: REGULATOR_FIXED_VOLTAGE
entry.label: Fixed voltage regulator support
entry.help: This driver provides support for fixed voltage regulators, useful for systems which use a combination of software managed regulators and simple non-configurable regulators.

entry.name: REGULATOR_VIRTUAL_CONSUMER
entry.label: Virtual regulator consumer support
entry.help:
This driver provides a virtual consumer for the voltage and current regulator API which provides sysfs controls for configuring the supplies requested. This is mainly useful for test purposes.
If unsure, say no.

entry.name: REGULATOR_USERSPACE_CONSUMER
entry.label: Userspace regulator consumer support
entry.help:
There are some classes of devices that are controlled entirely from user space. Userspace consumer driver provides ability to control power supplies for such devices.
If unsure, say no.

entry.name: REGULATOR_88PM800
entry.label: Marvell 88PM800 Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports Marvell 88PM800 voltage regulator chips. It delivers digitally programmable output, the voltage is programmed via I2C interface. It's suitable to support PXA988 chips to control VCC_MAIN and various voltages.

entry.name: REGULATOR_88PM8607
entry.label: Marvell 88PM8607 Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports 88PM8607 voltage regulator chips.

entry.name: REGULATOR_ACT8865
entry.label: Active-semi act8865 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a active-semi act8865 voltage output regulator via I2C bus.

entry.name: REGULATOR_ACT8945A
entry.label: Active-semi ACT8945A voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a active-semi ACT8945A voltage regulator via I2C bus. The ACT8945A features three step-down DC/DC converters and four low-dropout linear regulators, along with a ActivePath battery charger.

entry.name: REGULATOR_AD5398
entry.label: Analog Devices AD5398/AD5821 regulators
entry.help: This driver supports AD5398 and AD5821 current regulator chips. If building into module, its name is ad5398.ko.

entry.name: REGULATOR_ANATOP
entry.label: Freescale i.MX on-chip ANATOP LDO regulators
entry.help: Say y here to support Freescale i.MX on-chip ANATOP LDOs regulators. It is recommended that this option be enabled on i.MX6 platform.

entry.name: REGULATOR_AAT2870
entry.label: AnalogicTech AAT2870 Regulators
entry.help: If you have a AnalogicTech AAT2870 say Y to enable the regulator driver.

entry.name: REGULATOR_AB3100
entry.label: ST-Ericsson AB3100 Regulator functions
entry.help: These regulators correspond to functionality in the AB3100 analog baseband dealing with power regulators for the system.

entry.name: REGULATOR_AB8500
entry.label: ST-Ericsson AB8500 Power Regulators
entry.help: This driver supports the regulators found on the ST-Ericsson mixed signal AB8500 PMIC

entry.name: REGULATOR_ARIZONA
entry.label: Wolfson Arizona class devices
entry.help: Support for the regulators found on Wolfson Arizona class devices.

entry.name: REGULATOR_AS3711
entry.label: AS3711 PMIC
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the AS3711 PMIC

entry.name: REGULATOR_AS3722
entry.label: AMS AS3722 PMIC Regulators
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the AS3722 PMIC. This will enable support for all the software controllable DCDC/LDO regulators.

entry.name: REGULATOR_AXP20X
entry.label: X-POWERS AXP20X PMIC Regulators
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the AXP20X PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_BCM590XX
entry.label: Broadcom BCM590xx PMU Regulators
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the BCM590xx PMUs. This will enable support for the software controllable LDO/Switching regulators.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA903X
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9030/DA9034 regulators
entry.help: Say y here to support the BUCKs and LDOs regulators found on Dialog Semiconductor DA9030/DA9034 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA9052
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9052/DA9053 regulators
entry.help: This driver supports the voltage regulators of DA9052-BC and DA9053-AA/Bx PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA9055
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9055 regulators
entry.help:
Say y here to support the BUCKs and LDOs regulators found on Dialog Semiconductor DA9055 PMIC.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called da9055-regulator.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA9062
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9062 regulators
entry.help:
Say y here to support the BUCKs and LDOs regulators found on DA9062 PMICs.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called da9062-regulator.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA9063
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9063 regulators
entry.help:
Say y here to support the BUCKs and LDOs regulators found on DA9063 PMICs.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called da9063-regulator.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA9210
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9210 regulator
entry.help: Say y here to support for the Dialog Semiconductor DA9210. The DA9210 is a multi-phase synchronous step down converter 12A DC-DC Buck controlled through an I2C interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DA9211
entry.label: Dialog Semiconductor DA9211/DA9212/DA9213/DA9214/DA9215 regulator
entry.help: Say y here to support for the Dialog Semiconductor DA9211/DA9212 /DA9213/DA9214/DA9215. The DA9211/DA9212/DA9213/DA9214/DA9215 is a multi-phase synchronous step down converter 12A or 16A DC-DC Buck controlled through an I2C interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_DB8500_PRCMU
entry.label: ST-Ericsson DB8500 Voltage Domain Regulators
entry.help: This driver supports the voltage domain regulators controlled by the DB8500 PRCMU

entry.name: REGULATOR_FAN53555
entry.label: Fairchild FAN53555 Regulator
entry.help: This driver supports Fairchild FAN53555 Digitally Programmable TinyBuck Regulator. The FAN53555 is a step-down switching voltage regulator that delivers a digitally programmable output from an input voltage supply of 2.5V to 5.5V. The output voltage is programmed through an I2C interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_GPIO
entry.label: GPIO regulator support
entry.help: This driver provides support for regulators that can be controlled via gpios. It is capable of supporting current and voltage regulators and the platform has to provide a mapping of GPIO-states to target volts/amps.

entry.name: REGULATOR_HI6421
entry.label: HiSilicon Hi6421 PMIC voltage regulator support
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the HiSilicon Hi6421 PMU / Codec IC. Hi6421 is a multi-function device which, on regulator part, provides 21 general purpose LDOs, 3 dedicated LDOs, and 5 BUCKs. All of them come with support to either ECO (idle) or sleep mode.

entry.name: REGULATOR_HI655X
entry.label: Hisilicon HI655X PMIC regulators support
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators of the Hisilicon Hi655x PMIC device.

entry.name: REGULATOR_ISL9305
entry.label: Intersil ISL9305 regulator
entry.help: This driver supports ISL9305 voltage regulator chip.

entry.name: REGULATOR_ISL6271A
entry.label: Intersil ISL6271A Power regulator
entry.help: This driver supports ISL6271A voltage regulator chip.

entry.name: REGULATOR_LM363X
entry.label: TI LM363X voltage regulators
entry.help: This driver supports LM3631 and LM3632 voltage regulators for the LCD bias. One boost output voltage is configurable and always on. Other LDOs are used for the display module.

entry.name: REGULATOR_LP3971
entry.label: National Semiconductors LP3971 PMIC regulator driver
entry.help: Say Y here to support the voltage regulators and convertors on National Semiconductors LP3971 PMIC

entry.name: REGULATOR_LP3972
entry.label: National Semiconductors LP3972 PMIC regulator driver
entry.help: Say Y here to support the voltage regulators and convertors on National Semiconductors LP3972 PMIC

entry.name: REGULATOR_LP872X
entry.label: TI/National Semiconductor LP8720/LP8725 voltage regulators
entry.help: This driver supports LP8720/LP8725 PMIC

entry.name: REGULATOR_LP873X
entry.label: TI LP873X Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports LP873X voltage regulator chips. LP873X provides two step-down converters and two general-purpose LDO voltage regulators. It supports software based voltage control for different voltage domains

entry.name: REGULATOR_LP8755
entry.label: TI LP8755 High Performance PMU driver
entry.help: This driver supports LP8755 High Performance PMU driver. This chip contains six step-down DC/DC converters which can support 9 mode multiphase configuration.

entry.name: REGULATOR_LP8788
entry.label: TI LP8788 Power Regulators
entry.help: This driver supports LP8788 voltage regulator chip.

entry.name: REGULATOR_LTC3589
entry.label: LTC3589 8-output voltage regulator
entry.help: This enables support for the LTC3589, LTC3589-1, and LTC3589-2 8-output regulators controlled via I2C.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX14577
entry.label: Maxim 14577/77836 regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim MAX14577/77836 regulator via I2C bus. The MAX14577 regulators include safeout LDO and charger current regulator. The MAX77836 has two additional LDOs.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX1586
entry.label: Maxim 1586/1587 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 1586 or 1587 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for PXA27x chips to control VCC_CORE and VCC_USIM voltages.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX77620
entry.label: Maxim 77620/MAX20024 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls Maxim MAX77620 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for Tegra chip to control Step-Down DC-DC and LDOs. Say Y here to enable the regulator driver.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8649
entry.label: Maxim 8649 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 8649 voltage output regulator via I2C bus.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8660
entry.label: Maxim 8660/8661 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 8660/8661 voltage output regulator via I2C bus.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8907
entry.label: Maxim 8907 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 8907 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for Tegra chip to control Step-Down DC-DC and LDOs.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8925
entry.label: Maxim MAX8925 Power Management IC
entry.help: Say y here to support the voltage regulaltor of Maxim MAX8925 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8952
entry.label: Maxim MAX8952 Power Management IC
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 8952 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. Maxim 8952 has one voltage output and supports 4 DVS modes ranging from 0.77V to 1.40V by 0.01V steps.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8973
entry.label: Maxim MAX8973 voltage regulator
entry.help: The MAXIM MAX8973 high-efficiency. three phase, DC-DC step-down switching regulator delievers up to 9A of output current. Each phase operates at a 2MHz fixed frequency with a 120 deg shift from the adjacent phase, allowing the use of small magnetic component.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8997
entry.label: Maxim 8997/8966 regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 8997/8966 regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for S5PC110, S5PV210, and Exynos-4 chips to control VCC_CORE and VCC_USIM voltages.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX8998
entry.label: Maxim 8998 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 8998 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for S3C6410 and S5PC1XX chips to control VCC_CORE and VCC_USIM voltages.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX77686
entry.label: Maxim 77686 regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 77686 regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for Exynos-4 chips to control VARM and VINT voltages.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX77693
entry.label: Maxim 77693/77843 regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 77693/77843 regulators via I2C bus. The regulators include two LDOs, 'SAFEOUT1', 'SAFEOUT2' and one current regulator 'CHARGER'. This is suitable for Exynos-4x12 (MAX77693) or Exynos5433 (MAX77843) SoC chips.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MAX77802
entry.label: Maxim 77802 regulator
entry.help: This driver controls a Maxim 77802 regulator via I2C bus. The provided regulator is suitable for Exynos5420/Exynos5800 SoCs to control various voltages. It includes support for control of voltage and ramp speed.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MC13783
entry.label: Freescale MC13783 regulator driver
entry.help: Say y here to support the regulators found on the Freescale MC13783 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MC13892
entry.label: Freescale MC13892 regulator driver
entry.help: Say y here to support the regulators found on the Freescale MC13892 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MT6311
entry.label: MediaTek MT6311 PMIC
entry.help: Say y here to select this option to enable the power regulator of MediaTek MT6311 PMIC. This driver supports the control of different power rails of device through regulator interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MT6323
entry.label: MediaTek MT6323 PMIC
entry.help: Say y here to select this option to enable the power regulator of MediaTek MT6323 PMIC. This driver supports the control of different power rails of device through regulator interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_MT6397
entry.label: MediaTek MT6397 PMIC
entry.help: Say y here to select this option to enable the power regulator of MediaTek MT6397 PMIC. This driver supports the control of different power rails of device through regulator interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_PALMAS
entry.label: TI Palmas PMIC Regulators
entry.help:
If you wish to control the regulators on the Palmas series of chips say Y here. This will enable support for all the software controllable SMPS/LDO regulators.
The regulators available on Palmas series chips vary depending on the muxing. This is handled automatically in the driver by reading the mux info from OTP.

entry.name: REGULATOR_PBIAS
entry.label: PBIAS OMAP regulator driver
entry.help: Say y here to support pbias regulator for mmc1:SD card i/o on OMAP SoCs. This driver provides support for OMAP pbias modelled regulators.

entry.name: REGULATOR_PCAP
entry.label: Motorola PCAP2 regulator driver
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators of the PCAP2 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_PCF50633
entry.label: NXP PCF50633 regulator driver
entry.help: Say Y here to support the voltage regulators and convertors on PCF50633

entry.name: REGULATOR_PFUZE100
entry.label: Freescale PFUZE100/200/3000 regulator driver
entry.help: Say y here to support the regulators found on the Freescale PFUZE100/200/3000 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_PV88060
entry.label: Powerventure Semiconductor PV88060 regulator
entry.help: Say y here to support the voltage regulators and convertors PV88060

entry.name: REGULATOR_PV88080
entry.label: Powerventure Semiconductor PV88080 regulator
entry.help: Say y here to support the buck convertors on PV88080

entry.name: REGULATOR_PV88090
entry.label: Powerventure Semiconductor PV88090 regulator
entry.help: Say y here to support the voltage regulators and convertors on PV88090

entry.name: REGULATOR_PWM
entry.label: PWM voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver supports PWM controlled voltage regulators. PWM duty cycle can increase or decrease the voltage.

entry.name: REGULATOR_QCOM_RPM
entry.label: Qualcomm RPM regulator driver
entry.help:
If you say yes to this option, support will be included for the regulators exposed by the Resource Power Manager found in Qualcomm 8660, 8960 and 8064 based devices.
Say M here if you want to include support for the regulators on the Qualcomm RPM as a module. The module will be named "qcom_rpm-regulator".

entry.name: REGULATOR_QCOM_SMD_RPM
entry.label: Qualcomm SMD based RPM regulator driver
entry.help:
If you say yes to this option, support will be included for the regulators exposed by the Resource Power Manager found in Qualcomm 8974 based devices.
Say M here if you want to include support for the regulators on the Qualcomm RPM as a module. The module will be named "qcom_smd-regulator".

entry.name: REGULATOR_QCOM_SPMI
entry.label: Qualcomm SPMI regulator driver
entry.help:
If you say yes to this option, support will be included for the regulators found in Qualcomm SPMI PMICs.
Say M here if you want to include support for the regulators on the Qualcomm SPMI PMICs as a module. The module will be named "qcom_spmi-regulator".

entry.name: REGULATOR_RC5T583
entry.label: RICOH RC5T583 Power regulators
entry.help: Select this option to enable the power regulator of RICOH PMIC RC5T583. This driver supports the control of different power rails of device through regulator interface. The device supports multiple DCDC/LDO outputs which can be controlled by i2c communication.

entry.name: REGULATOR_RK808
entry.label: Rockchip RK808 Power regulators
entry.help: Select this option to enable the power regulator of ROCKCHIP PMIC RK808. This driver supports the control of different power rails of device through regulator interface. The device supports multiple DCDC/LDO outputs which can be controlled by i2c communication.

entry.name: REGULATOR_RN5T618
entry.label: Ricoh RN5T567/618 voltage regulators
entry.help: Say y here to support the regulators found on Ricoh RN5T567 or RN5T618 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_RT5033
entry.label: Richtek RT5033 Regulators
entry.help: This adds support for voltage and current regulators in Richtek RT5033 PMIC. The device supports multiple regulators like current source, LDO and Buck.

entry.name: REGULATOR_S2MPA01
entry.label: Samsung S2MPA01 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver controls Samsung S2MPA01 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. S2MPA01 has 10 Bucks and 26 LDO outputs.

entry.name: REGULATOR_S2MPS11
entry.label: Samsung S2MPS11/13/14/15/S2MPU02 voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver supports a Samsung S2MPS11/13/14/15/S2MPU02 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. The chip is comprised of high efficient Buck converters including Dual-Phase Buck converter, Buck-Boost converter, various LDOs.

entry.name: REGULATOR_S5M8767
entry.label: Samsung S5M8767A voltage regulator
entry.help: This driver supports a Samsung S5M8767A voltage output regulator via I2C bus. S5M8767A have 9 Bucks and 28 LDOs output and supports DVS mode with 8bits of output voltage control.

entry.name: REGULATOR_SKY81452
entry.label: Skyworks Solutions SKY81452 voltage regulator
entry.help:
This driver supports Skyworks SKY81452 voltage output regulator via I2C bus. SKY81452 has one voltage linear regulator can be programmed from 4.5V to 20V.
This driver can also be built as a module. If so, the module will be called sky81452-regulator.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TI_ABB
entry.label: TI Adaptive Body Bias on-chip LDO
entry.help: Select this option to support Texas Instruments' on-chip Adaptive Body Bias (ABB) LDO regulators. It is recommended that this option be enabled on required TI SoC. Certain Operating Performance Points on TI SoCs may be unstable without enabling this as it provides device specific optimized bias to allow/optimize functionality.

entry.name: REGULATOR_STW481X_VMMC
entry.label: ST Microelectronics STW481X VMMC regulator
entry.help: This driver supports the internal VMMC regulator in the STw481x PMIC chips.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS51632
entry.label: TI TPS51632 Power Regulator
entry.help: This driver supports TPS51632 voltage regulator chip. The TPS51632 is 3-2-1 Phase D-Cap+ Step Down Driverless Controller with Serial VID control and DVFS. The voltage output can be configure through I2C interface or PWM interface.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS6105X
entry.label: TI TPS6105X Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS61050/TPS61052 voltage regulator chips. It is a single boost converter primarily for white LEDs and audio amplifiers.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS62360
entry.label: TI TPS6236x Power Regulator
entry.help: This driver supports TPS6236x voltage regulator chip. This regulator is meant for processor core supply. This chip is high-frequency synchronous step down dc-dc converter optimized for battery-powered portable applications.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65023
entry.label: TI TPS65023 Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS65023 voltage regulator chips. TPS65023 provides three step-down converters and two general-purpose LDO voltage regulators. It supports TI's software based Class-2 SmartReflex implementation.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS6507X
entry.label: TI TPS6507X Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS6507X voltage regulator chips. TPS6507X provides three step-down converters and two general-purpose LDO voltage regulators. It supports TI's software based Class-2 SmartReflex implementation.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65086
entry.label: TI TPS65086 Power regulators
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on TI TPS65086 PMICs.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65090
entry.label: TI TPS65090 Power regulator
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the TI TPS65090 PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65217
entry.label: TI TPS65217 Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS65217 voltage regulator chips. TPS65217 provides three step-down converters and four general-purpose LDO voltage regulators. It supports software based voltage control for different voltage domains

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65218
entry.label: TI TPS65218 Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS65218 voltage regulator chips. TPS65218 provides six step-down converters and one general-purpose LDO voltage regulators. It supports software based voltage control for different voltage domains

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS6524X
entry.label: TI TPS6524X Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS6524X voltage regulator chips. TPS6524X provides three step-down converters and two general-purpose LDO voltage regulators. This device is interfaced using a customized serial interface currently supported on the sequencer serial port controller.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS6586X
entry.label: TI TPS6586X Power regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS6586X voltage regulator chips.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65910
entry.label: TI TPS65910/TPS65911 Power Regulators
entry.help: This driver supports TPS65910/TPS65911 voltage regulator chips.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS65912
entry.label: TI TPS65912 Power regulator
entry.help: This driver supports TPS65912 voltage regulator chip.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TPS80031
entry.label: TI TPS80031/TPS80032 power regualtor driver
entry.help: TPS80031/ TPS80032 Fully Integrated Power Management with Power Path and Battery Charger. It has 5 configurable step-down converters, 11 general purpose LDOs, VBUS generator and digital output to control regulators.

entry.name: REGULATOR_TWL4030
entry.label: TI TWL4030/TWL5030/TWL6030/TPS659x0 PMIC
entry.help: This driver supports the voltage regulators provided by this family of companion chips.

entry.name: REGULATOR_VEXPRESS
entry.label: Versatile Express regulators
entry.help: This driver provides support for voltage regulators available on the ARM Ltd's Versatile Express platform.

entry.name: REGULATOR_WM831X
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM831x PMIC regulators
entry.help: Support the voltage and current regulators of the WM831x series of PMIC devices.

entry.name: REGULATOR_WM8350
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8350 AudioPlus PMIC
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage and current regulators of the WM8350 AudioPlus PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_WM8400
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8400 AudioPlus PMIC
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators of the WM8400 AudioPlus PMIC.

entry.name: REGULATOR_WM8994
entry.label: Wolfson Microelectronics WM8994 CODEC
entry.help: This driver provides support for the voltage regulators on the WM8994 CODEC.

entry.name: MEDIA_SUPPORT
entry.label: Multimedia support
entry.help: If you want to use Webcams, Video grabber devices and/or TV devices enable this option and other options below. Additional info and docs are available on the web at <https://linuxtv.org>

entry.name: MEDIA_CAMERA_SUPPORT
entry.label: Cameras/video grabbers support
entry.help:
Enable support for webcams and video grabbers.
Say Y when you have a webcam or a video capture grabber board.

entry.name: MEDIA_ANALOG_TV_SUPPORT
entry.label: Analog TV support
entry.help:
Enable analog TV support.
Say Y when you have a TV board with analog support or with a hybrid analog/digital TV chipset.
Note: There are several DVB cards that are based on chips that support both analog and digital TV. Disabling this option will disable support for them.

entry.name: MEDIA_DIGITAL_TV_SUPPORT
entry.label: Digital TV support
entry.help:
Enable digital TV support.
Say Y when you have a board with digital support or a board with hybrid digital TV and analog TV.

entry.name: MEDIA_RADIO_SUPPORT
entry.label: AM/FM radio receivers/transmitters support
entry.help:
Enable AM/FM radio support.
Additional info and docs are available on the web at <https://linuxtv.org>
Say Y when you have a board with radio support.
Note: There are several TV cards that are based on chips that support radio reception. Disabling this option will disable support for them.

entry.name: MEDIA_SDR_SUPPORT
entry.label: Software defined radio support
entry.help:
Enable software defined radio support.
Say Y when you have a software defined radio device.

entry.name: MEDIA_RC_SUPPORT
entry.label: Remote Controller support
entry.help:
Enable support for Remote Controllers on Linux. This is needed in order to support several video capture adapters, standalone IR receivers/transmitters, and RF receivers.
Enable this option if you have a video capture board even if you don't need IR, as otherwise, you may not be able to compile the driver for your adapter.
Say Y when you have a TV or an IR device.

entry.name: MEDIA_CONTROLLER
entry.label: Media Controller API
entry.help:
Enable the media controller API used to query media devices internal topology and configure it dynamically.
This API is mostly used by camera interfaces in embedded platforms.

entry.name: MEDIA_CONTROLLER_DVB
entry.label: Enable Media controller for DVB (EXPERIMENTAL)
entry.help:
Enable the media controller API support for DVB.
This is currently experimental.

entry.name: VIDEO_V4L2_SUBDEV_API
entry.label: V4L2 sub-device userspace API
entry.help:
Enables the V4L2 sub-device pad-level userspace API used to configure video format, size and frame rate between hardware blocks.
This API is mostly used by camera interfaces in embedded platforms.

entry.name: VIDEO_ADV_DEBUG
entry.label: Enable advanced debug functionality on V4L2 drivers
entry.help: Say Y here to enable advanced debugging functionality on some V4L devices. In doubt, say N.

entry.name: VIDEO_FIXED_MINOR_RANGES
entry.label: Enable old-style fixed minor ranges on drivers/video devices
entry.help:
Say Y here to enable the old-style fixed-range minor assignments. Only useful if you rely on the old behavior and use mknod instead of udev.
When in doubt, say N.

entry.name: VIDEO_PCI_SKELETON
entry.label: Skeleton PCI V4L2 driver
entry.help: Enable build of the skeleton PCI driver, used as a reference when developing new drivers.

entry.name: V4L2_FLASH_LED_CLASS
entry.label: V4L2 flash API for LED flash class devices
entry.help:
Say Y here to enable V4L2 flash API support for LED flash class drivers.
When in doubt, say N.

entry.name: DVB_NET
entry.label: DVB Network Support
entry.help:
This option enables DVB Network Support which is a part of the DVB standard. It is used, for example, by automatic firmware updates used on Set-Top-Boxes. It can also be used to access the Internet via the DVB card, if the network provider supports it.
You may want to disable the network support on embedded devices. If unsure say Y.

entry.name: DVB_MAX_ADAPTERS
entry.label: maximum number of DVB/ATSC adapters
entry.help:
Maximum number of DVB/ATSC adapters. Increasing this number increases the memory consumption of the DVB subsystem even if a much lower number of DVB/ATSC adapters is present. Only values in the range 4-32 are tested.
If you are unsure about this, use the default value 8

entry.name: DVB_DYNAMIC_MINORS
entry.label: Dynamic DVB minor allocation
entry.help:
If you say Y here, the DVB subsystem will use dynamic minor allocation for any device that uses the DVB major number. This means that you can have more than 4 of a single type of device (like demuxes and frontends) per adapter, but udev will be required to manage the device nodes.
If you are unsure about this, say N here.

entry.name: RC_MAP
entry.label: Compile Remote Controller keymap modules
entry.help:
This option enables the compilation of lots of Remote Controller tables. They are short tables, but if you don't use a remote controller, or prefer to load the tables on userspace, you should disable it.
The ir-keytable program, available at v4l-utils package provide the tool and the same RC maps for load from userspace. Its available at http://git.linuxtv.org/cgit.cgi/v4l-utils.git/

entry.name: LIRC
entry.label: LIRC interface driver
entry.help: Enable this option to build the Linux Infrared Remote Control (LIRC) core device interface driver. The LIRC interface passes raw IR to and from userspace, where the LIRC daemon handles protocol decoding for IR reception and encoding for IR transmitting (aka "blasting").

entry.name: IR_LIRC_CODEC
entry.label: Enable IR to LIRC bridge
entry.help: Enable this option to pass raw IR to and from userspace via the LIRC interface.

entry.name: IR_NEC_DECODER
entry.label: Enable IR raw decoder for the NEC protocol
entry.help: Enable this option if you have IR with NEC protocol, and if the IR is decoded in software

entry.name: IR_RC5_DECODER
entry.label: Enable IR raw decoder for the RC-5 protocol
entry.help: Enable this option if you have IR with RC-5 protocol, and if the IR is decoded in software

entry.name: IR_RC6_DECODER
entry.label: Enable IR raw decoder for the RC6 protocol

entry.name: IR_XMP_DECODER

entry.help: Enable this option if you have IR with XMP protocol, and if the IR is decoded in software

entry.name: RC_ATI_REMOTE
entry.label: ATI / X10 based USB RF remote controls
entry.help:
Say Y here if you want to use an X10 based USB remote control. These are RF remotes with USB receivers.
Such devices include the ATI remote that comes with many of ATI's All-In-Wonder video cards, the X10 "Lola" remote, NVIDIA RF remote, Medion RF remote, and SnapStream FireFly remote.
This driver provides mouse pointer, left and right mouse buttons, and maps all the other remote buttons to keypress events.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called ati_remote.

entry.name: IR_ENE
entry.label: ENE eHome Receiver/Transceiver (pnp id: ENE0100/ENE02xxx)
entry.help:
Say Y here to enable support for integrated infrared receiver /transceiver made by ENE.
You can see if you have it by looking at lspnp output. Output should include ENE0100 ENE0200 or something similar.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called ene_ir.

entry.name: IR_HIX5HD2
entry.label: Hisilicon hix5hd2 IR remote control
entry.help:
Say Y here if you want to use hisilicon hix5hd2 remote control. To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called ir-hix5hd2.
If you're not sure, select N here

entry.name: IR_WINBOND_CIR

entry.help:

To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called winbond_cir.

entry.name: IR_IGORPLUGUSB
entry.label: IgorPlug-USB IR Receiver
entry.help:
Say Y here if you want to use the IgorPlug-USB IR Receiver by Igor Cesko. This device is included on the Fit-PC2.
Note that this device can only record bursts of 36 IR pulses and spaces, which is not enough for the NEC, Sanyo and RC-6 protocol.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called igorplugusb.

entry.name: IR_IGUANA
entry.label: IguanaWorks USB IR Transceiver
entry.help:
Say Y here if you want to use the IguanaWorks USB IR Transceiver. Both infrared receive and send are supported. If you want to change the ID or the pin config, use the user space driver from IguanaWorks.
Only firmware 0x0205 and later is supported.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called iguanair.

entry.name: IR_TTUSBIR
entry.label: TechnoTrend USB IR Receiver
entry.help:
Say Y here if you want to use the TechnoTrend USB IR Receiver. The driver can control the led.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called ttusbir.

entry.name: IR_RX51
entry.label: Nokia N900 IR transmitter diode
entry.help:
Say Y or M here if you want to enable support for the IR transmitter diode built in the Nokia N900 (RX51) device.
The driver uses omap DM timers for generating the carrier wave and pulses.

entry.name: IR_IMG
entry.label: ImgTec IR Decoder
entry.help: Say Y or M here if you want to use the ImgTec infrared decoder functionality found in SoCs such as TZ1090.

entry.name: IR_IMG_RAW
entry.label: Raw decoder
entry.help: Say Y here to enable the raw mode driver which passes raw IR signal changes to the IR raw decoders for software decoding. This is much less reliable (due to lack of timestamps) and consumes more processing power than using hardware decode, but can be useful for testing, debug, and to make more protocols available.

entry.name: IR_IMG_HW
entry.label: Hardware decoder
entry.help: Say Y here to enable the hardware decode driver which decodes the IR signals in hardware. This is more reliable, consumes less processing power since only a single interrupt is received for each scancode, and allows an IR scancode to be used as a wake event.

entry.name: IR_IMG_NEC
entry.label: NEC protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the NEC, extended NEC, and 32-bit NEC protocols in the ImgTec infrared decoder block.

entry.name: IR_IMG_JVC
entry.label: JVC protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the JVC protocol in the ImgTec infrared decoder block.

entry.name: IR_IMG_SONY
entry.label: Sony protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the Sony protocol in the ImgTec infrared decoder block.

entry.name: IR_IMG_SHARP
entry.label: Sharp protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the Sharp protocol in the ImgTec infrared decoder block.

entry.name: IR_IMG_SANYO
entry.label: Sanyo protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the Sanyo protocol (used by Sanyo, Aiwa, Chinon remotes) in the ImgTec infrared decoder block.

entry.name: IR_IMG_RC5
entry.label: Philips RC5 protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the RC5 protocol in the ImgTec infrared decoder block.

entry.name: IR_IMG_RC6
entry.label: Philips RC6 protocol support
entry.help: Say Y here to enable support for the RC6 protocol in the ImgTec infrared decoder block. Note: This version only supports mode 0.

entry.name: RC_LOOPBACK

Say Y here if you want support for the remote control loopback driver which allows TX data to be sent back as RX data. This is mostly useful for debugging purposes.
If you're not sure, select N here.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called rc_loopback.

entry.name: USB_VIDEO_CLASS

For more information see: <http://linux-uvc.berlios.de/>

entry.help:

entry.name: USB_PWC
entry.label: USB Philips Cameras
entry.help:
Say Y or M here if you want to use one of these Philips & OEM webcams: * Philips PCA645, PCA646 * Philips PCVC675, PCVC680, PCVC690 * Philips PCVC720/40, PCVC730, PCVC740, PCVC750 * Philips SPC900NC * Askey VC010 * Logitech QuickCam Pro 3000, 4000, 'Zoom', 'Notebook Pro' and 'Orbit'/'Sphere' * Samsung MPC-C10, MPC-C30 * Creative Webcam 5, Pro Ex * SOTEC Afina Eye * Visionite VCS-UC300, VCS-UM100
The PCA635, PCVC665 and PCVC720/20 are not supported by this driver and never will be, but the 665 and 720/20 are supported by other drivers.
Some newer logitech webcams are not handled by this driver but by the Usb Video Class driver (linux-uvc).
The built-in microphone is enabled by selecting USB Audio support.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called pwc.

entry.name: USB_PWC_DEBUG

Say Y here if you want to use this type of camera. Supported devices are typically found in some Asus laptops, with USB id 174f:a311 and 05e1:0501. Other Syntek cameras may be supported by the stk11xx driver, from which this is derived, see <http://sourceforge.net/projects/syntekdriver/>
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called stkwebcam.

entry.name: USB_S2255
entry.label: USB Sensoray 2255 video capture device
entry.help: Say Y here if you want support for the Sensoray 2255 USB device. This driver can be compiled as a module, called s2255drv.

entry.name: VIDEO_USBTV
entry.label: USBTV007 video capture support
entry.help:
This is a video4linux2 driver for USBTV007 based video capture devices.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called usbtv

entry.name: VIDEO_PVRUSB2
entry.label: Hauppauge WinTV-PVR USB2 support
entry.help:
This is a video4linux driver for Conexant 23416 based usb2 personal video recorder devices.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called pvrusb2

entry.name: VIDEO_PVRUSB2_SYSFS
entry.label: pvrusb2 sysfs support
entry.help:
This option enables the operation of a sysfs based interface for query and control of the pvrusb2 driver.
This is not generally needed for v4l applications, although certain applications are optimized to take advantage of this feature.
If you are in doubt, say Y.
Note: This feature is experimental and subject to change.

entry.name: VIDEO_PVRUSB2_DVB
entry.label: pvrusb2 ATSC/DVB support
entry.help:
This option enables a DVB interface for the pvrusb2 driver. If your device does not support digital television, this feature will have no affect on the driver's operation.
If you are in doubt, say Y.
config VIDEO_PVRUSB2_DEBUGIFC bool "pvrusb2 debug interface" depends on VIDEO_PVRUSB2_SYSFS ---help--- This option enables the inclusion of a debug interface in the pvrusb2 driver, hosted through sysfs.
You do not need to select this option unless you plan on debugging the driver or performing a manual firmware extraction.
If you are in doubt, say N.

entry.name: VIDEO_HDPVR
entry.label: Hauppauge HD PVR support
entry.help:
This is a video4linux driver for Hauppauge's HD PVR USB device.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called hdpvr

entry.name: VIDEO_USBVISION

entry.help:
There are more than 50 different USB video devices based on NT1003/1004/1005 USB Bridges. This driver enables using those devices.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called usbvision.

entry.help:

To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called go7007-usb.

entry.name: VIDEO_GO7007_LOADER

entry.name: VIDEO_AU0828

To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called au0828

entry.name: VIDEO_AU0828_V4L2

entry.help:
This is a video4linux driver for Auvitek's USB device.
Choose Y here to include support for v4l2 analog video capture within the au0828 driver.

entry.name: VIDEO_AU0828_RC
entry.label: AU0828 Remote Controller support
entry.help: Enables Remote Controller support on au0828 driver.

entry.name: VIDEO_CX231XX

entry.help:
This is a video4linux driver for Conexant 231xx USB based TV cards.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called cx231xx

entry.name: VIDEO_CX231XX_RC
entry.label: Conexant cx231xx Remote Controller additional support
entry.help:
cx231xx hardware has a builtin RX/TX support. However, a few designs opted to not use it, but, instead, some other hardware. This module enables the usage of those other hardware, like the ones used with ISDB-T boards.
On most cases, all you need for IR is mceusb module.

entry.name: VIDEO_CX231XX_ALSA
entry.label: Conexant Cx231xx ALSA audio module
entry.help:
This is an ALSA driver for Cx231xx USB based TV cards.

entry.name: VIDEO_CX231XX_DVB
entry.label: DVB/ATSC Support for Cx231xx based TV cards
entry.help: This adds support for DVB cards based on the Conexant cx231xx chips.

entry.name: VIDEO_TM6000
entry.label: TV Master TM5600/6000/6010 driver
entry.help:
Support for TM5600/TM6000/TM6010 USB Device
Since these cards have no MPEG decoder onboard, they transmit only compressed MPEG data over the usb bus, so you need an external software decoder to watch TV on your computer.
Say Y if you own such a device and want to use it.

entry.name: VIDEO_TM6000_ALSA
entry.label: TV Master TM5600/6000/6010 audio support
entry.help:
This is a video4linux driver for direct (DMA) audio for TM5600/TM6000/TM6010 USB Devices.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called tm6000-alsa.

entry.name: VIDEO_TM6000_DVB
entry.label: DVB Support for tm6000 based TV cards
entry.help: This adds support for DVB cards based on the tm5600/tm6000 chip.

entry.name: DVB_USB
entry.label: Support for various USB DVB devices
entry.help:
By enabling this you will be able to choose the various supported USB1.1 and USB2.0 DVB devices.
Almost every USB device needs a firmware, please look into <file:Documentation/dvb/README.dvb-usb>.
For a complete list of supported USB devices see the LinuxTV DVB Wiki: <https://linuxtv.org/wiki/index.php/DVB_USB>
Say Y if you own a USB DVB device.

entry.name: DVB_USB_DEBUG
entry.label: Enable extended debug support for all DVB-USB devices
entry.help: Say Y if you want to enable debugging. See modinfo dvb-usb (and the appropriate drivers) for debug levels.

entry.name: DVB_USB_A800
entry.label: AVerMedia AverTV DVB-T USB 2.0 (A800)
entry.help: Say Y here to support the AVerMedia AverTV DVB-T USB 2.0 (A800) receiver.

entry.name: DVB_USB_DIBUSB_MB
entry.label: DiBcom USB DVB-T devices (based on the DiB3000M-B) (see help for device list)
entry.help:
Support for USB 1.1 and 2.0 DVB-T receivers based on reference designs made by DiBcom (<http://www.dibcom.fr>) equipped with a DiB3000M-B demodulator.
For an up-to-date list of devices supported by this driver, have a look on the Linux-DVB Wiki at www.linuxtv.org.
Say Y if you own such a device and want to use it. You should build it as a module.

entry.name: DVB_USB_DIBUSB_MB_FAULTY
entry.label: Support faulty USB IDs
entry.help: Support for faulty USB IDs due to an invalid EEPROM on some Artec devices.

entry.name: DVB_USB_DIBUSB_MC

entry.help:
Support for USB2.0 DVB-T receivers based on reference designs made by DiBcom (<http://www.dibcom.fr>) equipped with a DiB3000M-C/P demodulator.
For an up-to-date list of devices supported by this driver, have a look on the Linux-DVB Wiki at www.linuxtv.org.
Say Y if you own such a device and want to use it. You should build it as a module.

entry.name: DVB_USB_DIB0700
entry.label: DiBcom DiB0700 USB DVB devices (see help for supported devices)
entry.help:
Support for USB2.0/1.1 DVB receivers based on the DiB0700 USB bridge. The USB bridge is also present in devices having the DiB7700 DVB-T-USB silicon. This chip can be found in devices offered by Hauppauge, Avermedia and other big and small companies.
For an up-to-date list of devices supported by this driver, have a look on the LinuxTV Wiki at www.linuxtv.org.
Say Y if you own such a device and want to use it. You should build it as a module.

Medion MD95700 hybrid USB2.0 device. DViCO FusionHDTV (Bluebird) USB2.0 devices

entry.name: DVB_TTUSB_BUDGET
entry.label: Technotrend/Hauppauge Nova-USB devices
entry.help:
Support for external USB adapters designed by Technotrend and produced by Hauppauge, shipped under the brand name 'Nova-USB'.
These devices don't have a MPEG decoder built in, so you need an external software decoder to watch TV.
Say Y if you own such a device and want to use it.

entry.name: DVB_TTUSB_DEC
entry.label: Technotrend/Hauppauge USB DEC devices
entry.help:
Support for external USB adapters designed by Technotrend and produced by Hauppauge, shipped under the brand name 'DEC2000-t' and 'DEC3000-s'.
Even if these devices have a MPEG decoder built in, they transmit only compressed MPEG data over the USB bus, so you need an external software decoder to watch TV on your computer.
This driver needs external firmware. Please use the commands "<kerneldir>/Documentation/dvb/get_dvb_firmware dec2000t", "<kerneldir>/Documentation/dvb/get_dvb_firmware dec2540t", "<kerneldir>/Documentation/dvb/get_dvb_firmware dec3000s", download/extract them, and then copy them to /usr/lib/hotplug/firmware or /lib/firmware (depending on configuration of firmware hotplug).
Say Y if you own such a device and want to use it.

entry.help: Choose if you would like to have Siano's support for USB interface

This is an ALSA driver for some Empia 28xx based TV cards.
This is not required for em2800/em2820/em2821 boards. However, newer em28xx devices uses Vendor Class for audio, instead of implementing the USB Audio Class. For those chips, this module will enable digital audio.

entry.name: USB_HACKRF
entry.label: HackRF
entry.help:
This is a video4linux2 driver for HackRF SDR device.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called hackrf

entry.name: MEDIA_PCI_SUPPORT
entry.label: Media PCI Adapters
entry.help: Enable media drivers for PCI/PCIe bus. If you have such devices, say Y.

entry.name: VIDEO_MEYE
entry.label: Sony Vaio Picturebook Motion Eye Video For Linux
entry.help:
This is the video4linux driver for the Motion Eye camera found in the Vaio Picturebook laptops. Please read the material in <file:Documentation/video4linux/meye.txt> for more information.
If you say Y or M here, you need to say Y or M to "Sony Laptop Extras" in the misc device section.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called meye.

entry.name: VIDEO_SOLO6X10
entry.label: Bluecherry / Softlogic 6x10 capture cards (MPEG-4/H.264)
entry.help:
This driver supports the Bluecherry H.264 and MPEG-4 hardware compression capture cards and other Softlogic-based ones.
Following cards have been tested: * Bluecherry BC-H16480A (PCIe, 16 port, H.264) * Bluecherry BC-H04120A (PCIe, 4 port, H.264) * Bluecherry BC-H04120A-MPCI (Mini-PCI, 4 port, H.264) * Bluecherry BC-04120A (PCIe, 4 port, MPEG-4)

entry.name: STA2X11_VIP
entry.label: STA2X11 VIP Video For Linux
entry.help:
Say Y for support for STA2X11 VIP (Video Input Port) capture device.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called sta2x11_vip.

entry.name: VIDEO_TW68
entry.label: Techwell tw68x Video For Linux
entry.help:
Support for Techwell tw68xx based frame grabber boards.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called tw68.

entry.name: VIDEO_TW686X
entry.label: Intersil/Techwell TW686x video capture cards
entry.help:
Support for Intersil/Techwell TW686x-based frame grabber cards.
Currently supported chips: - TW6864 (4 video channels), - TW6865 (4 video channels, not tested, second generation chip), - TW6868 (8 video channels but only 4 first channels using built-in video decoder are supported, not tested), - TW6869 (8 video channels, second generation chip).
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be named tw686x.

entry.name: VIDEO_ZORAN

Say Y for support for MJPEG capture cards based on the Zoran 36057/36067 PCI controller chipset. This includes the Iomega Buz, Pinnacle DC10+ and the Linux Media Labs LML33. There is a driver homepage at <http://mjpeg.sf.net/driver-zoran/>. For more information, check <file:Documentation/video4linux/Zoran>.
To compile this driver as a module, choose M here: the module will be called zr36067.

entry.name: VIDEO_ZORAN_LML33

entry.name: VIDEO_ZORAN_AVS6EYES
